content:
Diagnosis:		Metastatic lung adenocarcinoma, left lower lobe

Staging:		T3N2M1b KRAS G12V mutant, EGFR wild type
	CT 15 March 2024: 4.8cm left lower lobe mass with mediastinal nodes, multiple liver metastases and bone involvement

Treatment:		Cycle 3 Carboplatin/Pemetrexed completed 10 April 2024

MDT Discussion:	Lung MDT 18 April 2024

Radiology review confirms stable disease with primary mass measuring 4.6cm (previously 4.8cm), stable liver metastases, and no new sites of disease. Blood results show stable biochemistry and acceptable haematological parameters for continuation of treatment.

MDT Recommendation:	1. Continue with planned cycle 4 Carboplatin/Pemetrexed
			2. Arrange interval CT chest/abdomen/pelvis after cycle 4
			3. Review in medical oncology clinic with scan results

Plan:		Proceed with cycle 4 chemotherapy on 24 April 2024
		CT scan booked for 15 May 2024
		Clinic review arranged for 22 May 2024

primary_cancer.metastases: multiple liver metastases and bone involvement
primary_cancer.biomarker_status: KRAS G12V mutation positive, EGFR negative

cancer_timeline.value: CT shows 4.8cm left lower lobe mass with mediastinal nodes, multiple liver metastases and bone involvement
CT shows stable disease with primary mass measuring 4.6cm, stable liver metastases, no new sites of disease

patient_facts.value: Stable biochemistry and acceptable haematological parameters

status_updates.value: Metastatic KRAS mutant lung adenocarcinoma showing stable disease after 3 cycles of first-line chemotherapy
Stable disease with minimal reduction in primary mass size from 4.8cm to 4.6cm
Continue with planned cycle 4 Carboplatin/Pemetrexed on 24 April 2024
Medical oncology clinic review with scan results on 22 May 2024
